speaker: Skyline
text: The light atop the space needle flashes.  _ACT 1  Scene 1 -- Cafe Nervosa. Roz and Frasier are seated.  Kenny brings them coffee. _

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thank you for the coffee, Kenny.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, you don't have to thank me.  We're not keeping score. Life's too short to keep track of who owes who for this or that or whatnot.  Let's just enjoy ourselves.

speaker: Frasier
text: Whatever you want, Kenny, the answer is no.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_caught_] Just hear me out.  Look, I need a favor but before I tell you what it is, I want you to look at this.

speaker: Frasier
text: "KACL Psychographics."

speaker: Kenny
text: We hired a firm to sift through the program data and give us a kind of profile on each show's average listener.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, let's see. [_reading_] Gil's average listener is a woman, mid-30's, well-educated, hmmm...  What about my average listener.  Who is she?

speaker: Kenny
text: [_taking the papers_] Well, actually, uh, she's an older gentleman... [_Frasier reacts unhappily_] who likes to keep the radio on for company.

speaker: Roz
text: Ouch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, and Roz, it seems a number of listeners think you're a man.

speaker: Roz
text: What?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_indicating the data_] I'm sorry the-the station spent its money on this nonsense, but this research is patently absurd.

speaker: Kenny
text: Regardless, you could really stand to increase your audience in the youth market.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I thought we upped the advertising budget for that very reason.

speaker: Kenny
text: I did, but I need some help.  How would you like to be a guest on _Teen Scene_?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Kenny.  I've done that show before, I'm not doing it again.

speaker: Kenny
text: Doc, you could use younger listeners.  You've seen the research.

speaker: Frasier
text: My show is fine.  That so-called _research_ is nothing but a bunch of... confounded correlations and mediocre deductions. _A Caf e guest, Lucy, approaches the table. _

speaker: Lucy
text: Excuse me, are you Dr. Frasier Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, as a matter of fact I am.

speaker: Lucy
text: Can I get your autograph?

speaker: Frasier
text: What's your name?

speaker: Lucy
text: Lucy.  But make it out to Paul.  I volunteer at his hospice, and I think you're just about the only friend he has left anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Kenny_] Fine, I'll meet the kids. **NILES GETS HIS DAILY DOSE OF SPINACH** _Scene 2 - Frasier's apartment. Niles and Daphne are seated on the couch._

speaker: Niles
text: I have a little something for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ohh... Earrings.  They're beautiful.

speaker: Niles
text: Try them on.  I've disinfected them with peroxide.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, it's a lovely thought, but you kind of gave me the exact same pair last summer.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I did not.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, take a look.

speaker: Niles
text: I am _so_ sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't be silly.  It was bound to happen sometime after all the nice presents you give me.  I'll just have to get pierced somewhere else.

speaker: Niles
text: Still, I... _He reacts to what she has just said with shock and then a cheesy smile. Somewhat taken aback, he then mouths "What?"  Daphne grins.  Martin enters in his robe._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, well, look who's up.  How was your company party, Mr. Crane?

speaker: Martin
text: Fine.

speaker: Niles
text: Sounds like it was more than just fine if you're getting up this late.

speaker: Daphne
text: He came in late, too.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sitting at the table_] Didn't know there was a curfew.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rising, moving toward him_] Oh my God!  Is that lipstick on your chin?  It is!

speaker: Martin
text: I got kissed, okay?  Big whoop.

speaker: Martin
text: There's no lipstick on my chin.

speaker: Daphne
text: Busted!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, so what's her name?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, when can we meet her?

speaker: Martin
text: Her name's Peg, and nobody's meeting anyone.  It was just a little fooling around, that's all.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, are you going to see her again?

speaker: Martin
text: No, and if she calls I'm not here, got it?  I don't want to encourage her.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, why not?  It sounds like you had fun.

speaker: Martin
text: See, this is exactly the conversation I'm trying to avoid with Peg.  You kiss a girl, and suddenly she wants to know "What does it mean?" and "When can I see you again?" "Why don't you call me?"

speaker: Daphne
text: [_disdainfully_] That's a wonderful attitude.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, it was great and I loved it, but I don't want to ruin it by making it more than it was.  Women never let you have a bite of ham.  They always make you sit down for spinach. _Niles and Daphne ponder his point.  FADE OUT.  Scene 3 -- Cafe Nervosa. Frasier and Roz are seated.  Kirby walks in and approaches them. _

speaker: Kirby
text: Whoa!  This is embarrassing, huh?  All three of us going to the same place when we're skipping out on work.

speaker: Frasier
text: We are not skipping out on work.

speaker: Kirby
text: Right, we're all at the doctor's. [_chuckles "knowingly"_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kirby, we don't work the same hours that you do.  We're done for the day.

speaker: Kirby
text: Oh, yeah, that's good.  It's better if we don't all use the same excuse. [_He sits._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kirby, I think it's time for you to straighten up.  You show up late every day.  You are inattentive, and you have a bad attitude.  How do you expect to thrive in this job or any other job?  I am this close to giving you a lecture!

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, guys.  Uh, Doc, you got a minute?  There's someone I want you to meet. _We see Emily seated in the corner.  She is well-dressed, sitting up straight, looking the typical high school honor student._

speaker: Kirby
text: Oh, dude, that's Emily Crowther - one of the nimrods from Those guys go to my old high school.  A bunch of losers.

speaker: Kenny
text: For your information, Kirb... Hey, I thought you were at the doctor.

speaker: Kirby
text: I was.  Uh, he says everything is fine.  He also said I probably shouldn't come in tomorrow until about 11:30.

speaker: Kenny
text: How dumb do you think I am?  You will show up first thing tomorrow morning - after your "Meals on Wheels" delivery.

speaker: Kirby
text: You got it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] Listen, Kenny, I'm actually just on my way out. Perhaps I could meet this young lady tomorrow at the station?

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, come on.  Say hi to the kid.  She's a big fan.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, gosh, I would hate to appear standoffish. After all, the young lady has built up a certain image of me in her mind, and that shouldn't be crushed certainly. [_He puts on his coat._]

speaker: Roz
text: Do we have to go through this _every_ time?  Go over there! _She gestures for them to leave, twice.  Frasier and Kenny walk to the corner where Emily is seated.  Emily rises._

speaker: Kenny
text: Emily Crowther.  Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Emily.

speaker: Emily
text: Pleased to meet you, Dr. Crane!  I look forward to having you on our show!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, technically, I haven't agreed to do it yet.  You see, I had a rather bad experience on _Teen Scene_ the last time.

speaker: Emily
text: [_exuberant_] Are you familiar with the new _Teen Scene_?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh, no, actually I'm not.

speaker: Emily
text: [_jumping in excitedly_] Well then you don't know that we do hard- hitting journalism with a youthful bent! [_slipping into obvious flattery_] Of course, it's not _nearly_ as distinguished as your show, which I adore. _Her nose is quite brown at this point -- and Frasier laps it up. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Really.

speaker: Kenny
text: Big fan!

speaker: Emily
text: Dr. Crane, may I be frank?  Having you on our show would be, In your own words, "a great boon" to us.

speaker: Frasier
text: A boon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you really think so?

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, major boon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then, consider it granted.  I'm sure we'll have a splendid time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who knows, I may even learn something from you.

speaker: Emily
text: Oh, you flatter me, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Who's manning the Pasquini?

speaker: Frasier
text: Jimmy Ray! [_he exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: Capital. [_he takes off his coat and moves to the counter_] Cappuccino, please.  Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Niles.  What are you doing here?  Shouldn't you be out buying Daphne another pair of earrings?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh... please, don't make me feel any worse.

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, I thought it was sweet.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I feel just awful.

speaker: Roz
text: You want to know what I would do?

speaker: Niles
text: [_hesitating_] Oh, what the hell? [_He sits._]

speaker: Roz
text: First of all, enough with the earrings.  Everything doesn't have to be so fancy.  Don't get me wrong.  Jewelry is terrific, but sometimes a woman likes to know that you're paying attention.  Mix it up a little.  Do something crazy - I mean totally out there.

speaker: Niles
text: Are you talking about scarves? [_The waiter hands him his cup._] Thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_regrouping after Niles's question_] OK, let me give you an example.  When I was 20, my boyfriend stole a "Doyle's Pub" sign for me.  We were drunk and we saw it, and he said "Hey, that's your name on that sign.  You should have it."  It was spontaneous, and a little dangerous... and very romantic!

speaker: Niles
text: [_thoughtful, the wheels turning_] Spontaneous and dangerous... Thanks, Roz.  You've given me something to mull over during my herbal wrap. _He sips his coffee thoughtfully.  FADE OUT.  Scene 4 - Frasier's apartment. Martin enters.  Daphne is carrying a food tray to the table._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, good.  I thought you were going to miss Dr. Crane on the radio.

speaker: Martin
text: How many times a day is that guy on?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not his show, it's _Teen Scene_.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I don't have time for that teenage crap. [_taking off his coat_] Did I get a call from a girl today?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_carrying the tray to the coffee table_] You mean Peg?

speaker: Martin
text: Or any girl.  Or Peg. [_fishing_] Did Peg call?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.  It's been a few days, hasn't it?

speaker: Martin
text: I really thought she'd try to spring that relationship stuff on me.  Well, I guess I misjudged her. [_He sits in his chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Unless she didn't like her free sample.

speaker: Martin
text: [_grinning and chuckling_] I think we can rule that out.  When a lady gets the full Marty Crane treatment, she doesn't forget it.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_coyly_] And Peg got the Full Marty?

speaker: Martin
text: I never give anything less.  So, yeah, I guess I am a little surprised she hasn't called.  I mean, mostly relieved, of course, but... also surprised.

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't feel bad.  Maybe you had an off night.

speaker: Martin
text: [_snorting sarcastically_] Anything's possible, I suppose. _The phone rings.  Daphne slowly moves to answer it, making Martin squirm.  She picks it up on the third ring._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello? [_excitedly_] Well, yes he is! One moment please.

speaker: Martin
text: [_imitating Al Pacino ("Scent of a Woman")_] Hola! [_Daphne rolls her eyes._] Uh-huh.   Oh, I think that would be fine. Thursday at 9:00?  See you then.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well... look who's suddenly in a relationship!

speaker: Martin
text: Shows you what you know.  That was the dentist.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank goodness, right?

speaker: Martin
text: Right! _Daphne nods sarcastically behind his back and heads for the kitchen. Martin stares forlornly at the phone.  FADE OUT.  END OF ACT 1  ACT 2  Scene 5 - Radio Station. Frasier is standing in the hall outside the studio talking to Emily, who is standing primly, with a very officious attitude._

speaker: Emily
text: I agree with you, sir.  The difference between valedictorian and salutatorian is largely arbitrary.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Emily.  I didn't mean to go on like that, but... the wound is still raw.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Kirby.

speaker: Kirby
text: [_icily_] Hello _Emily_.  How's Honors everything?

speaker: Emily
text: Splendid, thank you. [_disdainfully_] How's carrying a bunch of boxes around a radio station?

speaker: Kirby
text: Good.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Emily, I was thinking that perhaps after the show I could invite you and your friends to a... a cheeseburger or some such.

speaker: Emily
text: Oh, we'd like that very much. [_Her grin is cheesier than the proposed burger._] Can I get you a coffee?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  Thank you, Emily.  You know I asked for one a little while ago, but it never showed up.

speaker: Kirby
text: [_shouting down the hall at Emily, dodging Frasier's anger_] Now who's carrying a bunch of stuff around a radio station? _Frasier groans at Kirby.  CUT TO: the interior of the studio.  A man is seated at Frasier's usual console.  He is smoking heavily, and his hair and clothes are very unkempt.  Frasier enters._

speaker: Andy
text: Hi, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Andy
text: Andy McNiff. [_They shake hands._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Andy.

speaker: Andy
text: I'm the moderator.  I'm really glad you could make it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well... likewise, I look forward to some intergenerational byplay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, by the way, Andy, are you going to be smoking all night?

speaker: Andy
text: [_looking at his pack, which is apparently full_] Yeah. [_Frasier's displeasure shows._] Look, no matter what happens, I'm on your side.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_confused_] Thank you.  What does that mean exactly?

speaker: Andy
text: Well, uh... _He is interrupted by the appearance of Emily and two male friends who enter from the booth._

speaker: Andy
text: Hi, guys!  Your guest has arrived.

speaker: Emily
text: [_handing Frasier a mug_] Here's your coffee, Dr. Crane.  These are my colleagues, Ryan and Trent.

speaker: Frasier
text: Trent. [_They shake hands._]

speaker: Trent
text: Pleased to meet you, sir.  We're very excited.

speaker: Frasier
text: Likewise.  Hello, Ryan. _He shakes Ryan's hand.  Ryan and Trent also look the role of the honor student, both wearing Dockers and collared shirts._

speaker: Andy
text: [_on a signal from a producer in the booth_] Ten seconds, guys. [_He puts on headphones._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_somewhat nervous_] Ah, right. [_He sits back down._] You know, you may be surprised to learn that it was not so very many years ago when I myself occupied those tough years 'twixt 12 and 20. _He puts on headphones, as do the three youths.  They take their places on stools in front of microphones behind Andy, looking like the stunt double line-up for a movie starring Ryan Phillipe, Reese Witherspoon, and Freddie Prinze, Jr.  Andy opens the show._

speaker: Andy
text: Hi, and welcome to _Teen Scene_ , Seattle's premier talk show for young people.  I'm Andy McNiff, and for the next 60 minutes we'll be engaged in some straight talk with our special guest. [_Frasier grins._] And here to get things rolling is our _Teen Scene_ panel: Trent, Ryan, and Emily.  Trent?

speaker: Trent
text: Tonight, we're talking to Dr. Frasier Crane, a man who knows what makes us tick.  But what do we know about him?

speaker: Emily
text: Dr. Crane, you're a popular psychiatrist and radio personality. What would you say is the secret of your success?

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose it has something to do with the fact that I am a good listener and have a friendly voice, and I also try to pass along some real psychological insight and advice.

speaker: Emily
text: [_glancing at her notes_] My research shows that your replies Are typically less than five minutes long.  Doesn't seem like a lot of time for substantive psychological advice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well if I believe there's a real problem than I usually refer the caller...

speaker: Emily
text: [_interrupting him with an evil grin_] So if it's a real problem than you pass the buck. _Frasier, dumbfounded, looks and mouths words at Andy, who seems disinterested and looks away._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?!

speaker: Ryan
text: February 9, 1993.  Does that date mean anything to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Should it?

speaker: Ryan
text: According to the _Boston Globe_ you spent two hours on a ledge threatening to jump if your wife left you.

speaker: Ryan
text: How many of your listeners are aware that they're taking advice from a man who was nearly a stain on the sidewalk?  [_N.B. This event occurred in an episode of the last season of "Cheers."  The only other references to it on "Frasier" of which I am aware are in Episodes[[1.02]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_2/space_quest.html "Space Quest") "Space Quest," [[2.18]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_18/the_club.html "The Club") "The Club," and, obliquely, in [[1.08]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_8/beloved_infidel.html "Beloved Infidel") "Beloved Infidel."_] _Andy does not intervene, but taps the spent end of his cigarette into the ashtray, seeming somewhat oblivious._

speaker: Frasier
text: Andy, isn't it about time for a commercial break?

speaker: Andy
text: Actually, this show is a public service, therefore commercial- free.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_resigned_] Splendid. _FADE OUT.  Scene 6 - A residential street, presumably in suburban Seattle.  Niles is walking Eddie down the street.  He is dressed in black from head to toe, including a trench coat.  He passes a street lamp. A pause.  He moves with stealth back to the lamp, with Eddie in tow.  The camera reveals the top of the lamp, which also serves as the corner street indicator.  The two signs read "Maple Street 1700," and, far more significantly, "Daphne Lane 200."  Niles looks around nervously.  Eddie barks.  Niles whistles.  Eddie lifts his leg and appears to do his business on the lamp pole.  They are briefly illuminated by the headlights of a passing vehicle.  Niles whistles at Eddie again, and he lowers his leg.  He gives Eddie a treat and walks with him to the hedge behind the sidewalk.  Niles pulls a folding stepladder from behind the hedge.  He stands it next to the pole.  He then flips back his coat to reveal a tool belt, from which he takes a wrench.  (Who does he think he is, Batman?  And any seasoned burglar would have told him to go motorized, sacrificing silence for speed. - Mike Lee)  Looking up at the sign, he places the wrench in his mouth and begins to climb the ladder, but is interrupted by Eddie barking at something. He climbs back down, hurriedly sticks the ladder back behind the hedge, removes the wrench from his mouth, and moves Eddie back to the pole, whistling again.  Eddie repeats the leg-lifting routine.  A couple of pedestrians walk past, and Niles nervously waves and says "Hi" to them as they go by.  He whistles at Eddie again, who lowers his leg.  He gives him another treat, retrieves the ladder again, and again places it next to the pole.  He climbs the ladder and places his hands on top of the "Daphne Lane" sign.  Nervously, he begins to use the wrench to undo the bolts attaching the sign to the pole.  As he does so, he loses his balance.  Struggling to regain it, he inadvertently kicks the ladder away, so that it is no longer under his feet. He is left hanging from the sign.  Eddie barks repeatedly.  Niles is then literally "caught in the headlights" as we hear a car pull up.  The sound of a siren reveals the nature of the car. He stares mortified into the lights, still hanging from the sign. Eddie continues to bark.  FADE OUT.  Scene 7 - The lobby of the office building where Martin works as a security guard.  A woman in uniform is seated behind the desk, reading a book. Martin enters from the elevator._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, hi, Peg!  Geez, I didn't know you were working the graveyard tonight.

speaker: Peg
text: All this month.  What brings you here?

speaker: Martin
text: Actually, I was in the neighborhood, and I wanted to make sure they'd fixed that elevator camera.  But see, I thought Rich was on tonight, which explains why I didn't know you'd be here. [_He grins nervously._]

speaker: Peg
text: Right. Well, it's... fixed.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's good. _There is an awkward pause.  Martin remains standing at the desk while Peg goes back to her book._

speaker: Martin
text: Somebody broke it.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, then.

speaker: Peg
text: See ya later.

speaker: Martin
text: See ya.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, how come I never heard from you?

speaker: Peg
text: [_flustered_] Oh, geez!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I was under the impression we had some chemistry going. I think I deserved at least a phone call.

speaker: Peg
text: Hey, we made out a little.  Let's not ruin it by making it more than it was.

speaker: Martin
text: Just what I was thinking.

speaker: Peg
text: Good.  Then it won't be awkward or anything if we pull the same shift, right?

speaker: Martin
text: [_with feigned indifference_] What are you talking about? Don't worry about me.  Watch yourself.

speaker: Peg
text: Okay.  No worries. [_They shake hands._] So I'll see you around then.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, see ya.

speaker: Peg
text: Hey! You going to Jerry's retirement party?

speaker: Martin
text: I might drop in for a pop or two.

speaker: Peg
text: Yeah, same.  Maybe I'll see you there.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  Maybe you will. _Martin takes this as an affirmation, which boosts his confidence. He resumes the "Full Marty" demeanor as he struts to the elevator. FADE OUT.  Scene 8 - Radio Station. Frasier's appearance on "Teen Scene" continued.  Things have obviously degenerated even further._

speaker: Frasier
text: Again, I freely admit that I assisted my ex-wife in psychological experiments on lab animals.  However, at that time, putting a pair of sunglasses on a monkey did not constitute cruelty! _His gestures and expressions during this speech indicate that his level of exasperation has increased considerably._

speaker: Emily
text: [_smugly, confrontational_] We'll just agree to disagree.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know I scarcely see how this line of questioning about my personal life can benefit your listeners!

speaker: Emily
text: Well, Dr. Crane.  Every day you ask your listeners to blindly trust you.  Isn't the public entitled to know a little bit more about that "friendly voice" that seems to know all the answers?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh... I understand.  This isn't about me at all.  You see, Your combative line of questioning is completely age- appropriate.  The challenging of authority, the zeal for truth...

speaker: Ryan
text: Speaking of truth, I have a few questions about your last tax return... [_of which he has a copy, rifling through it_]

speaker: Andy
text: I hate to interrupt, panel, but it's time for our regular news break.  We'll be back with more _Teen Scene_ fun after this. _They remove their headphones.  Frasier is shell-shocked.  Kirby sticks His head in the door._

speaker: Kirby
text: Dr. Crane, can I borrow you for a second?

speaker: Emily
text: [_with the old grin_] You're doing great! _Frasier glares murderously at her as he exits the studio.  He joins Kirby in the hall._

speaker: Kirby
text: Dude, you're in trouble here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for the update!

speaker: Kirby
text: Take it easy, Mr. Snappy.  I'm here to help you. _Kirby shows him a notebook.  CUT BACK to the studio:_

speaker: Trent
text: Can you believe that Kirby guy works here?

speaker: Emily
text: I can't believe they finally graduated him.

speaker: Andy
text: Now, remember, guys, you're still goodwill ambassadors...

speaker: Emily
text: [_cutting him off disdainfully_] We weren't talking to you.

speaker: Andy
text: [_giving up, taking another drag_] Oh-kay. _Frasier re-enters, looking much happier.  He is carrying Kirby's notebook._

speaker: Trent
text: Everything okay, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely.  I didn't fully appreciate the hard-hitting nature or your journalism, but I... I think I know how to handle it now.

speaker: Andy
text: We're back with more _Teen Scene_ and our special guest, Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Trent
text: Now, Dr. Crane, where were we?

speaker: Frasier
text: I believe we were discussing my competence as a mental health professional.  And though it is true that I have suffered several emotional setbacks in my life, if we are to be honest... haven't we all?

speaker: Trent
text: And that's your defense... that we all have problems.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps I can better illustrate my point by reading from a Poem entitled, "An Onion for Trisha."

speaker: Trent
text: [_taken aback_] Where did you get that?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reading_] "My heart is like an onion, filled with layers of tears.  Why, oh, why did you leave me, Trisha?"

speaker: Trent
text: Okay, give me that.

speaker: Emily
text: [_clearly upset_] Trisha _Sharpe_?  You said you never liked her!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gleefully_] Ooh, Trent, tough blow!  Yes, it seems that youthful relationships are _fraught_ with emotional hazards. Especially in the case of a -- [_flips to another page_] a young woman who finds her first love at Math Camp.

speaker: Trent
text: What happened at Math Camp?!

speaker: Emily
text: [_highly distressed_] I don't want to talk about it!

speaker: Ryan
text: [_trying to save the situation_] Uh, Dr. Crane!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Ryan. [_leafing through the notebook_] Or as the boys on the swim team call you...

speaker: Ryan
text: [_cutting in desperately_] So, do you have any good advice for kids that want to go to college?

speaker: Frasier
text: As a matter of fact, I believe I do. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 9 - Time fade to the end of the show. Frasier has taken over the show.  His three interrogators are slumped on their stools, looking depressed and defeated._

speaker: Frasier
text: In short, caller, there is nothing wrong with you, and you're not going to get sick.  But remember, the more frequently you do it, the less special it becomes.

speaker: Frasier
text: I hope that answers your question.

speaker: Mike
text: [_v.o._] Uh, yeah.  Well, uh, thanks a lot.

speaker: Andy
text: Well, that about wraps it up for tonight's _Teen Scene._  For Trent, Ryan, and Emily, this is Andy McNiff - reminding you we're still taking applications for the moderator's job - and wishing you a teen-tastic week.  Good night! _They go off the air.  The three teens quickly grab their notes and head for the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, kids, I had fun!

speaker: Trent
text: [_icily_] Yeah, thanks.

speaker: Andy
text: Thank you.  You made my month. _Frasier chuckles and shakes Andy's hand heartily.  Frasier exits the studio, where Kirby is waiting in the hall._

speaker: Kirby
text: Way to go, Dr. Crane, that was sweet!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not exactly proud of myself, Kirby.

speaker: Kirby
text: Oh, you should be, man, those dinks brought it on themselves. They were, like, "We're gonna get this old dude!" and then you were, like, "Old dude!  Say what?" and then they were like "Wham bam!... [_he descends into gibberish imitations of their arguing._] It was awesome.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well said, Kirby.  And thank you for helping me out.  By the way, how did you dig up all that stuff?

speaker: Kirby
text: Uh, let's just say I've got a few operatives who were, uh, Held back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Kirby
text: Hey, you know, why don't you and I continue this conversation over a... a cheeseburger or some such.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd like that very much. _They put their arms around each other as they walk down the hall. And we:  FADE OUT  END OF ACT 2_
